positive_comments: The deep dive into AI and the qualities a well-equipped leader will need to be able assess and use the new technologies... a tool both in organizational management AND quality judgment calls when implementing. Heavy on the role and impact of AI in the world and workplace.
improvement_opportunities: I would address more intentionally what/why/how an event/world move classifies as disruptive AND I would separate out the transformational LEADER from transformational leadership... not just the what of what we do but the HOW of how we do it.   I am a big believer that the first course out of the gate sets the stage and level sets for all additional modules. So I'm approaching this analysis from that perspective. For instance, I would pull out Mandela and some of the others you address in Module 2 and discuss it a bit more upfront for level-setting.  I found it premature to immediately jump to AI without first setting the historical and personal stage. We need transformational leaders - because....? What models can we draw from when assessing our role in transformation? Context for their disruption.   After clarifying what we are solving for, then I would jump into the AI conversation.  I think it might tie Modules 1 and 2 together better so the two concepts follow a stream of thought.. and connect the PERSON of the moment to the disruptive moment itself.

positive_comments: Favorite module - focusing on the person and the impact of their "humanness" during times of disruption.  Love the Mandela story and docs, movie. I wouldn't change anything content-wise. WE are the variable, the "x" factor in any environment we find ourselves in so self-awareness, reflection, etc are paramount to surviving in this current work environment.
improvement_opportunities: As I mentioned for Module 1, I would perhaps evaluate scope and sequence of thought and content... where do they overlap and are there themes we are working to focus on throughout the course.   The only subtopic I would like to see more of is navigating and influencing from the almost middle... i.e. COOs, CFOs, etc.  How does the C-suite interact together and separately? How to influence the Boss (CEO or Board) towards positive outcomes that are measurable and inspirational.  Recalibrating the ethical conversation.
